author: mmusich
body:
#### PR description:

During the preparation of the Bad FED channel scenario for the 2023 MC production (documented at this [cmsTalk](https://cms-talk.web.cern.ch/t/new-pixel-status-scenarios-and-probabilities-for-2023-mc/28126)) it was noticed that the `SiPixelFEDChannelContainer`  and `SiPixelQuality` payload inspectors gave different sets of masked ROCs even if they should have been in principle contained the same sets.
This was traced back (thanks to @tsusa) to a erroneous mapping of the ROCs within the module in the `SiPixelFEDChannelContainer_PayloadInspector`.
This is fixed in this PR, together with miscellaneous graphical improvements.

#### PR validation:

Tested by comparing the output of 

```console
getPayloadData.py \
    --plugin pluginSiPixelQuality_PayloadInspector \
    --plot plot_SiPixelBPixQualityMap \
    --tag SiPixelQuality_byPCL_stuckTBM_v1 \
    --time_type Lumi \
    --iovs '{"start_iov": "1589554511348014", "end_iov": "1589554511348014"}' \
    --db Prod \
    --test ;
```
(IOV `1589554511348014` correpsonds in packed cond Time to `run 370097, LS 302`) and compared it with the output of the command

```console
getPayloadData.py \
    --plugin pluginSiPixelFEDChannelContainer_PayloadInspector \
    --plot plot_SiPixelBPixFEDChannelContainerMap \
    --tag SiPixelStatusScenarios_StuckTBM_2023_v1_mc \
    --input_params '{"Scenarios": "370097_302"}' \
    --time_type Run \
    --iovs '{"start_iov": "1", "end_iov": "1"}' \
    --db Prod \
    --test ;
```

before and after the PR.
Here are the results:
